senses.de: The end of a period of time during which something is valid.
senses.ex: Expiry of the contract will be in two years.

Tips.title: Validity Period
Tips.description: Expiry marks the end of a time when something can be used or is effective.
Tips.example: Check the expiry on your passport before booking a trip.

Tips.title: Common Usage
Tips.description: Often used in the context of perishable items like food, medications, or offers.
Tips.example: The expiry of the discount is at midnight, so we need to hurry!

senses.de: The cessation of a right or privilege through neglect to exercise it within some limit of time.
senses.ex: After the expiry of the deadline, you would not be able to claim for the loss.

Tips.title: Legal Rights
Tips.description: Expiry can indicate when legal or formal rights are no longer valid.
Tips.example: Upon the expiry of the patent, the invention can be used freely by others.

Tips.title: Time Limits
Tips.description: Used to talk about the last moment an action can be taken or a claim made.
Tips.example: Notify us before the expiry of your trial to avoid being charged.

senses.de: The end of the life or duration of something.
senses.ex: The expiry of a law or rule means it is no longer valid.

Tips.title: Legal Use
Tips.description: In legal contexts, expiry relates to laws, regulations, or official rules ending.
Tips.example: The expiry of the temporary tax law will revert rates to previous levels.

Tips.title: Technical Terminology
Tips.description: Used in technical and legal discussions to describe the end of validity.
Tips.example: The committee is reviewing the implications of the expiry of the statute.

Cessation.wordDefinition:
Cessation means "an end to something." It implies the termination of an activity or behavior. For example, when a person quits smoking, it can be said that there has been a cessation of smoking.

Expiry means "the end of the validity or usefulness of something," such as a document or product. It implies the cessation of the legal or effective period of something.

Cessation refers to the end of an action or behavior, while expiry refers to the end of the usefulness or validity of something.

Closure.wordDefinition:
Closure refers to the act of officially bringing something to an end or completion.

Closure is about ending something officially, while expiry is about the end of a pre-determined time period.

Conclusion.wordDefinition:
Conclusion refers to the end or result of something that has happened or been discussed.

The difference between the two words is that conclusion refers to the result of a thought process or discussion, while expiry refers to the end of a period of time or an agreement.

Deadline.wordDefinition:
Deadline refers to a specific time or date by which something needs to be completed or submitted.

It is typically used in the context of work, projects, assignments, or applications. For example, a student might have a deadline to submit an essay by the end of the week.

A deadline is a time by which something needs to be done, while expiry is when something is no longer valid or usable.

End.wordDefinition:
End refers to the point where something stops, finishes, or comes to a conclusion.

It can be used in various situations, such as the end of a book, the end of a journey, or the end of a relationship.

To summarize, end refers to the conclusion of something, while expiry refers to the date when something is no longer usable or valid.

Finish.wordDefinition:
Expiry and finish are related to the end of a period or process but they are used in different contexts.

Expiry refers to the end of something that has a limited duration or a specific date by which it must be finished. For example, a driver's license or a credit card has an expiry date that marks the end of its validity.

Finish refers to the completion of a task or activity.

For example, finishing a book or a movie means reaching the end of it, regardless of how long it takes. Finishing a project at school means completing it to the best of your ability.

Expiry refers to the end of a set duration or date, while finish refers to the completion of a task or activity.

Terminate.wordDefinition:
Terminate means to end something abruptly or forcefully, usually by one party's decision. For example, if an employee is terminated from their job, it means they have been fired and are no longer employed by that company.

In simpler terms, expiry means a natural end while terminate means an abrupt end. Expiry is used for things like food, medicine, and contracts while terminate is used for things like employment, contracts, and relationships.

quotes.Text: We cannot let fear and terror dictate how we live our lives, no matter what. Life is a blessing with an expiration date, and we must embrace it while we can.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Carmen Carrera

quotes.Text: There is no expiry date on love, there is no age by which you stop loving and there is so much of love out there in the world.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Pooja Bedi

quotes.Text: I've got more important things to think about. I've got a yogurt to finish by today, the expiry date is today.
quotes.Title: Scottish Athlete
quotes.Name: Gordon Strachan

quotes.Text: In my mind, I've always checked out in 2037; that's always been my expiration date. I'll be 75.
quotes.Title: Canadian Author
quotes.Name: Douglas Coupland

quotes.Text: Racism has a very quick expiration date when exposed to actual contact with people.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Hasan Minhaj

quotes.Text: Ideas have a short shelf life. You must act on them before the expiration date.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: John C. Maxwell

quotes.Text: Dance is a profession with an expiration date for many people.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Noah Baumbach

quotes.Text: I don't know if there is an expiration date on diversity.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Natasha Rothwell

quotes.Text: Good art doesn't really have an expiration date on it.
quotes.Title: Venezuelan Musician
quotes.Name: Devendra Banhart

quotes.Text: Believing in love doesn't have an expiration date.
quotes.Title: Canadian Musician
quotes.Name: Lara Fabian
